snippet: The Oscar nominees' lunch yields interesting tidbits, like the level of applause for "The Help" stars.
abstract: The Oscar nominees' lunch yields interesting tidbits, like the level of applause for "The Help" stars.
lead_paragraph: Awards season close-watchers - and folks, we're all close-watchers - do some real eye-drilling at the annual nominees' luncheon, which gathers everyone in a Beverly Hills hotel ballroom with scrambled seating (actors next to documentarians next to tech whizzes). The idea is that everyone is equal, but awards-watchers know that some people are just a little more equal. At The Hollywood Reporter, Scott Feinberg notes that there was significant applause for "The Help" stars Viola Davis and Octavia Spencer, first-time nominee (and long-time deserver) Gary Oldman and best supporting actor wild card Nick Nolte.
